title: Cookie-innerHTML
description: The application reads the 'user' cookie and renders it via innerHTML. Unlike document.write, innerHTML does NOT execute <script> tags. You must find another way.
objectives: Understand that <script> tags inserted via innerHTML are not executed by the browser.
Bypass this restriction using event handlers like or
hints: Injecting <script>alert(1)</script> will insert the element into the DOM, but the JS won't run.
Try using an HTML tag that executes code when it loads or fails to load.
body:
Cookie -> innerHTML Sink

Use ?username=YOUR_PAYLOAD to infect the cookie.
